answerText: Heine-Borel theorem[10] The actual definition of compact is that every cover of the space has one of these.
heading: DEES |2014 | Penn A | 7 | Science | Math | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Part of the proof of this theorem can be used to show that any compact subset of a Hausdorff space is closed.  [10] Name this theorem that states that subsets of Euclidean space are compact if and only if they are closed and bounded.
